intro: Silene hideakiohbae, commonly known as the Hideakiohbae campion, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its small, showy blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, Silene hideakiohbae is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
